events.title: What will the rate of core PCE inflation be in September 2023?

markets.description: If the (single-decimal) month-over-month percent change in the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy is above 0.5% in September 2023 according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis, then the market resolves to Yes.

If the (single-decimal) month-over-month percent change in the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy is above 0.4% in September 2023 according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis, then the market resolves to Yes.

If the (single-decimal) month-over-month percent change in the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy is above 0.3% in September 2023 according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis, then the market resolves to Yes.

If the (single-decimal) month-over-month percent change in the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy is above 0.2% in September 2023 according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis, then the market resolves to Yes.

If the (single-decimal) month-over-month percent change in the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy is above 0.1% in September 2023 according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis, then the market resolves to Yes.

events.title: What will the rate of core PCE inflation be in December 2022?

markets.description: If (single-decimal) Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy increases by more than -0.1% in December 2022 according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis, then the market resolves to Yes.

If (single-decimal) Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy increases by more than 0.7% in December 2022 according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis, then the market resolves to Yes.

If (single-decimal) Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy increases by more than 0.6% in December 2022 according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis, then the market resolves to Yes.

If (single-decimal) Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy increases by more than 0.5% in December 2022 according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis, then the market resolves to Yes.

If (single-decimal) Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy increases by more than 0.4% in December 2022 according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis, then the market resolves to Yes.

If (single-decimal) Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy increases by more than 0.3% in December 2022 according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis, then the market resolves to Yes.

If (single-decimal) Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy increases by more than 0.2% in December 2022 according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis, then the market resolves to Yes.

If (single-decimal) Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy increases by more than 0.1% in December 2022 according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis, then the market resolves to Yes.

If (single-decimal) Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy increases by more than 0.0% in December 2022 according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis, then the market resolves to Yes.
